ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: By taking this course, it allowed me to understand fully about the introductry concepts of microeconomics, which I will be studying in the graduate school from this autumn. Since I was taking this course, it was easier for me to complete the modules that were provided by the graduate school.

The knowledge of economics and some of the microeconomics theories and principles taught by this course have very practical applications for everyday life, and help you understand the world through a different lens. It was very eye opening and interesting.
I have basic knowledge for microecon. This course is very practical, I am very interested to have further study in this area.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: If possible, the copy of the textbook should be provided online as well. Since I am living in Japan right now, I had difficulty obtaining the textbook to read.

The strengths are that the professor is very good at teaching the material - he gives very good practical examples that help you understand the economic concepts better. There were really no weaknesses, just that the course is very fast paced in the summer so be prepared for that.
The course is too fast but it is reasonable as the class is compressed in 5 weeks.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I will recommend this course to another student because I think this course enabled me to fully understand the introductry concept of microeconomics in just a month. Moreover, since this course was done in online, I was able to participate the live class from Japan, where I currently live right now. I assume summer courses in other schools are rarely done in online these days, thus this class was an ideal course for students living outside of US in summer.

Yes I recommend taking this course even if you are not an economics major. The economic principles you learn have very good and practical applications to everyday life, especially if you want to enter the workforce.

Yes, the pace of the class is relatively fast since it is only 5 weeks but Tolga does a great job of keeping the material engaging and, as long as you do the pre-lecture work, it is actually fairly easy to understand even with the rapid pace.
Yes. The professor is very funny and patient to all the students.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: From this autumn, I am attending a microeconomic class in Harvard Kennedy School, so I will first use the knowledge and skills I've learned in this course to earn a credit in that class as well.
